results.abstract: Osama Mohsen, a Syrian soccer coach who was tripped as he sought refuge from a civil war, found a job outside Madrid. But he still has anxieties about his future.

multimedia.caption: Osama Mohsen was tripped by a camerawoman as he tried to cross the Hungarian border with his son on the way to Germany last year. Footage of the episode garnered global attention, and Mohsen was offered a job at a Spanish school.

results.abstract: Iran played South Korea in Tehran on Tuesday, the eve of the most solemn religious days in the country. Fans were urged not to cheer out of respect for religious values.

multimedia.caption: Iranian soccer fans held up a flag before a soccer match between Iran and South Korea in Tehran on Tuesday. Clerics urged fans not to cheer for their team during the match, which coincided with one of the most solemn religious holidays in Iran.

results.title: Iran Wins a Big Game, but Cheering Is Out of Bounds
